```{r, message = FALSE}
# Load libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(stringr)
source("helper.R")
```

```{r}
# Read in raw data from the Bask survey. These are the files downloaded from survey monkey saved as a .csv
raw_data_bask <- read.csv("data/bask_text.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

```{r}
# Pull out all responses for Q33 (a single selection question) combine, then determine 'question n'
Q33 <- "On.average..how.much.do.you.pay..in.US.dollars..for.your.medications.on.a.monthly.basis.out.of.pocket."

Q33_bask <- get_single_selection(data = raw_data_bask, q.name = Q33)

Q33_all <- rbind(Q33_bask)

number_of_people_Q33 <- length(unique(Q33_all$id))
```


```{r}
# Save all question data as csv (save question n and N at end of file as "_x.x")
write.csv(Q33_all, 'bask_q33_medication_cost_15.34.csv', row.names = FALSE)
```
